model

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Board
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DynamicBoard, StaticBoard

    public abstract class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class ensuring logic related to the contents, size and drawing of the game board.

    • Method Detail

      • newBoard

        public abstract void newBoard()
        Creates new instances of currentBoard and nextBoard.

      • draw

        public abstract void draw(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas boardCanvas,
                          javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                          double size,
                          javafx.scene.paint.Color aliveCellColor,
                          javafx.scene.paint.Color deadCellColor,
                          javafx.scene.paint.Color gridColor)
        A draw function that loops through every cell of the board and draws a square of the appropriate color at the cells' position on the canvas. Gap between squares is reduced the smaller the cell size to improve visual quality.
        Parameters:
        boardCanvas - the canvas to draw onto
        gc - GraphicsContext of the canvas
        size - size of each cell
        aliveCellColor - color used to draw live cells
        deadCellColor - color used to draw dead cells
        gridColor - color used to draw edge around canvas

      • drawGrid

        public abstract void drawGrid(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                              double size,
                              javafx.scene.paint.Color gridColor)
        Draws a cell grid on the canvas. This method is only called when the game is paused to provide visual aid when user is drawing on the game board or analysing the pattern. Grid line width is reduced the smaller the cell size to correspond with draw().
        Parameters:
        gc - the GraphicsContent to draw onto the canvas with
        size - size of each cell
        gridColor - color used to draw the grid

      • nextGeneration

        public abstract void nextGeneration()
        Loops through every cell and counts the amount of live neighbor cells in each direction. The next status of each cell is put in the nextBoard array, and what this status should be is based on the rules currently in use in the GoL class. At the end of the loops, the nextBoard is set to be the new currentBoard. This is done in order to avoid mix of data between the old, and the new state of the board, which would result in false patterns.

      • nextGenerationConcurrent

        public abstract void nextGenerationConcurrent(int cores,
                                              int core)

      • updateCurrentFromNextBoard

        public abstract void updateCurrentFromNextBoard()
        Copy the values from nextBoard to currentBoard. This moves the game to the next generation.

      • setBoardSizeToDimensions

        public abstract void setBoardSizeToDimensions(Board board,
                                              int newHeight,
                                              int newWidth)
        Expand or shrink the board to fit new dimensions given in DimensionInputDialog.
        Parameters:
        board - the current live game board
        newHeight - the target height of the board
        newWidth - the target width of the board

      • calculateBoardSize

        public abstract void calculateBoardSize(double canvasHeight,
                                        double canvasWidth)
        Adds new rows to the board array if the new cell sizes set makes the board not fully cover the canvas, in order to auto-fill the board.
        Parameters:
        canvasHeight - height of canvas
        canvasWidth - width of canvas

      • cellClick

        public abstract void cellClick(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event,
                               javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                               javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas boardCanvas)
                        throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Change the alive status of each cell, and give this cell its new color based on this status. Gets the coordinates of the click, calculates which cell is located in this coordinate based on the part of the board currently visible on the canvas. visitedCellWithDrag is used in order to avoid giving the cell a new status whenever the mouse drag is exited, and therefore this mouse release event is activated.
        Parameters:
        event - of the mouse click on canvas
        gc - GraphicsContext of the canvas to draw with
        boardCanvas - the canvas clicked
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      • cellDrag

        public abstract void cellDrag(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event,
                              javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                              javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas boardCanvas)
                       throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Functionally the same as cellClick. visitedCellWithDrag is an array which contains the board coordinates of the last visited cell, in order to avoid multiple re-calculations of the cell currently targeted by the mouse pointer.
        Parameters:
        event - of the mouse click and drag on canvas
        gc - GraphicsContext of the canvas to draw with
        boardCanvas - the canvas clicked
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
